meanings.definition: A person or thing that whiffs.
meanings.sent1: The whiffers in the kitchen were the cookies baking in the oven.
meanings.sent2: I saw the whiffers of smoke coming from the chimney.
meanings.sent3: The little dog thought he was one of the whiffers when he barked at the mailman.
meanings.sent4: The whiffers of laughter filled the room, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The sweet whiffers of flowers in the garden made me happy.

meanings.sent1: Her quick whiffers helped her detect the delicious scent of fresh bread.
meanings.sent2: The sudden whiffers of perfume caught me by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The whiffers of popcorn from the movie theater made my stomach growl.
meanings.sent4: The whiffers of success lingered in the air after his big achievement.
meanings.sent5: The whiffers of rain signaled an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: To whiff or emit a whiff.
meanings.sent1: She whiffers the scent of the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The bakery always whiffers the aroma of freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally whiffers the spices into the dish, creating a unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: The campfire whiffers smoke into the night sky, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: As she opened the bottle, it whiffers a strong scent of perfume.
